alternative_parents.description: Monoterpenoids containing 1 ring in the isoprene chain.
alternative_parents.name: Monocyclic monoterpenoids

alternative_parents.description: Monoterpenoids containing at least one aromatic ring.
alternative_parents.name: Aromatic monoterpenoids

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a phenylpropane moiety.
alternative_parents.name: Phenylpropanes

alternative_parents.description: Carboxylic acids containing exactly one carboxyl groups.
alternative_parents.name: Monocarboxylic acids and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a carboxylic acid group with the formula -C(=O)OH.
alternative_parents.name: Carboxylic acids

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an oxide group.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxides

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a carbonyl group, with the general structure RC(=O)R', where R=organyl, R'=H, N, O, organyl group or halide group.
alternative_parents.name: Carbonyl compounds

class.description: Compounds with a structure containing a benzene ring conjugated to a propanoic acid.
class.name: Phenylpropanoic acids

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as phenylpropanoic acids. These are compounds with a structure containing a benzene ring conjugated to a propanoic acid.

direct_parent.description: Compounds with a structure containing a benzene ring conjugated to a propanoic acid.
direct_parent.name: Phenylpropanoic acids

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

superclass.description: Organic compounds that are synthesized either from the amino acid phenylalanine (phenylpropanoids) or the decarboxylative condensation of malonyl-CoA (polyketides). Phenylpropanoids are aromatic compounds based on the phenylpropane skeleton. Polyketides usually consist of alternating carbonyl and methylene groups (beta-polyketones), biogenetically derived from repeated condensation of acetyl coenzyme A (via malonyl coenzyme A), and usually the compounds derived from them by further condensations.
superclass.name: Phenylpropanoids and polyketides
